In 1862, the Government of the day had brought down a bill to amend the Separate School Act of Upper Canada, and without expressing an opinion as to its merits, he might say it had produced a very strong feeling of indignation, A mass meeting was held in Toronto to con- demn the bill, and the people were so exas- perated that they had called upon certain members of the Government to resign.
